Same; lien not impaired when deed fails to pass title or when real property bid off to city or county. Nothing herein shall be construed to impair the lien for taxes on real estate deeded for delinquent taxes, in case the deed shall from any cause fail to pass a title to such property; nor to impair the lien on any real property bid off to any city or county, and unassigned. History: L. 1881, ch. 114, § 4; May 10; R.S. 1923, 79-2604. Prev Article 26. - FLOATING AND FEDERAL LIENS Next 2025. Powered by KLISS. Rendered: 2025-12-31T10:14:06. Head Rev No: 1485844(I)
